sub_title: Jr. Business Controller at Booking.com | Co-founder & Board member at Neúnavní Foundation | CEMS MiM Graduate
summary:
Internationally-minded double-degree graduate in M.Sc. Economics and Management with work and life experience in six countries and a background in various industries. Experienced in project management and strategy development. 

Thanks to my diverse experience, I am used to quickly exploring the value-adding aspects of my teams and delivering results in a short-period of time. I consider myself a problem solver who constantly looks for ways to learn something new. I love to work in teams, but do not shy away from personal accountability or leadership roles.

After many years of moving countries for studies and work, I am soon relocating to Amsterdam, NL, and am looking for a challenging opportunity to put my enthusiasm, experience and skills to a great use.

PA to the Artistic Director | Artistic Administration at Bregenz Festival

projects.title: GyBu Team vs. Real Top Praha
projects.description: An exhibition match between the students of Gymnázia Budějovická and Real Top Praha, which is a team of famous people. This exhibition had 2 goals. Firstly, we wanted to collect money to help children suffering cystic fibrosis. Secondly, we wanted to promote the GyBu Liga, which is the only football competition organised solely by students in Prague. We were very successful and managed to collect about CZK 40 000.

contributors.headline: Jr. Business Controller at Booking.com | Co-founder & Board member at Neúnavní Foundation | CEMS MiM Graduate

projects.title: Business Project - Market Entry Strategy for the Russian Bioplastics Market
projects.description: The Business Project, that is a part of the CEMS curriculum, was realised in cooperation with Ilim Group. This Russian-based company focuses mainly on the production of paper and pulp. However, the goal of the project was to analyze the possibility of entering the Russian market for bioplastics and decide whether the company should enter the market or not. Also, the team was to suggest alternative markets and market-entry strategies.

contributors.headline: Jr. Business Controller at Booking.com | Co-founder & Board member at Neúnavní Foundation | CEMS MiM Graduate

projects.title: University Trading Challenge 2015-2016
projects.description:
We discovered this competition during our 2nd year at Škoda Auto University. The challenge is held by an Italian financial brokerage company Directa S.I.M.p.A..

The University Trading Challenge is a half-year event focused on finance and education, it is a real money international online trading championship, and has reached its 6th edition. 

Every team, comprising at least 3 students, receives real 5000 €. The winner is who achieves the biggest profit. 

Our team is called "The Daring Individuals".

contributors.headline: Jr. Business Controller at Booking.com | Co-founder & Board member at Neúnavní Foundation | CEMS MiM Graduate

projects.title: Rok průmyslu a technického vzdělávání
projects.description:
This project was focused on issues concerning the education of technical subjects in the Czech Republic. The goal was to connect schools from the whole country with companies and to discuss issues regarding education and funding opportunities with the government.

I was in charge of communication with all partners, journalists and schools and helped organise one of the panel discussions.

contributors.headline: Jr. Business Controller at Booking.com | Co-founder & Board member at Neúnavní Foundation | CEMS MiM Graduate

projects.title: GyBu Liga
projects.description:
I was one of the co-directors of this every-year football competition played at the Gymnázium Budějovická in Prague. The fact that the league is organised solely by students and is very similar to professional leagues, makes it very unique among other students competitions in Prague. 
More than 100 students take part in GyBu Liga every year and many other students come to visit matches every week and support their favourite teams.
Over the course of the two years, we managed to negotiate a new budget with the school management which tripled during the period.
We also introduced new events, such as BudCup, a one-day indoor tournament. All-Star Game was held at the end of the season. 
GyBu Liga exists to date and is now run by younger students.

contributors.headline: Jr. Business Controller at Booking.com | Co-founder & Board member at Neúnavní Foundation | CEMS MiM Graduate

profile_positions.description:
Main focus on: 
- advocacy work and communication with authorities and policy-makers 
- fundraising activities, mostly online fundraising 
- PR and awareness raising, e.g., podcasts, communication with the media 
- overall strategic direction of the Foundation
profile_positions.title: Co-founder & Board Member

profile_positions.description:
Following my idea to start helping patients suffering from chronic fatigue syndrome, we started the Neunavni Foundation (the Indefatigueable). 

Been personally responsible for or helped establish: 
- Foundation's overall vision and strategy 
- fundraising strategy 
- visual identity 
- cooperation with the official patients' organisation 
- partnership with the patients 
- Foundation's communication strategy

In the first year, we organised:
- a successful crowdfunding campaign
- a fundraising event in the cooperation with Google, Procter&Gamble and L'Oréal
- a public happening to attract more attention to the topic
- gained significant public exposure and appeared in a number of news articles
and were selected as one of only 6 organisations to participate in the Open Society Fund's Advocacy program.
profile_positions.title: CEO & Co-founder

profile_positions.description:
Worked as a business controller for the entire People department. 

Achievements and responsibilities: 
- Fully responsible for quarterly financial planning and analysis for the People and Real-estate departments. Supported the annual budget planning for the same departments.
- Rolled-out automated monthly Management & FTE reporting for the department's senior leadership, incl. new operational  KPIs. Later adopted by other departments and their leadership teams. 
- Co-developed a tactical investment framework to streamline decision-making process.
- Managed the month- and quarter-end close procedure for 1.5 years as well as supervised diligent treatment of aged accruals and purchase orders.
- Simplified the technical process of loading forecast by adjusting and automating the forecasting models for the department. 
- Refined & maintained the headcount and financial company-level contingent workforce reporting, presented to the exec board on a weekly basis.
- Supported the launch of a new travel-allowance policy in EMEA by conducting a financial impact sensitivity analysis & setting up reporting guidelines. 
- Led the FP&A Communications & Ways of Working work-stream, focusing on the community atmosphere in the team.
profile_positions.title: Junior Business Controller

profile_positions.description:
Personally managed 3 virtual teams consisted of students located in different countries.

1) Assisted an American-European start-up organisation with a digital transformation of their in-person workshops as a response to COVID-19 but also the ever more digital world.

2) Advised a well-established American NGO that provides self-development courses for prisoners across the U.S. As a result, we provided them with a digitised version of their courses, step-by-step reusable manual, advised them on the right approach for partnership with other stakeholders and prepared a detailed marketing communication strategy.

3a) Consulted a young Nigerian-European NGO supporting the youth and small communities in Nigeria through investments mainly in education. With the team, we analysed the conditions for corporate donations across the EU, prepared a roadmap for the NGO to secure new sources of corporate funding and invented processes for the organisation's social reporting.

3b) A follow-up project with the Nigerian-European NGO with the aim of developing a fundraising strategy for individual/private donors and public donors such as international aid funds or large foundations. Over the course of the project, the team and I also developed a social media strategy for the client.

4) The team under my supervision developed a sustainable and long-term fundraising strategy for a global NGO. The NGO works very closely with the UN and connects thousands of mostly high-school students around the world. We developed and delivered a clear selection matrix for the search of prospective partners, step-by-step communication guidelines for the client's representatives, social media strategy and a clear roadmap to establishing regional fundraising teams.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager (Pro-bono)

profile_positions.description:
Achievements during the internship:
- Refined the department's COVID-19 monitoring. Re-invented the processes and communication with HEINEKEN local OpCos, enhanced the team press-review process, aligned the key tasks across several functions.
- Launched and managed a data-driven internal communications project across the company's operations in Africa. This led to a clear and monitored increase in the activity levels of all employees by +20 %.
-  Developed a new reporting process to monitor internal communication activity. The process has become the new standard for HEINEKEN globally.
- Assisted with and co-created the new independent communication strategy of Heineken Africa Foundation.

volunteer_experiences.description: Assisting Bátor Tábor Czech Republic to raise awareness, funds and develop the network of corporate and social partners prior to the launch of the first-ever Bátor Tábor camp in the Czech Republic.
Weekly sessions with elementary and high-school students. The initiative is part of People In Need's activities focusing on the integration of children from socio-economically disadvantaged families.
